title: Emilia Clarke reunited with ‘Game of Thrones’ costars Jason Momoa and Kit Harington for her 33rd birthday, and the photos are adorable
text:
caption Jason Momoa and Emilia Clarke on “The Graham Norton Show.” source BBC

Emilia Clarke posted an Instagram photo of her reunion with “Game of Thrones” costars Jason Momoa and Kit Harington as part of her 33rd birthday celebrations.

Clarke, who will appear in the upcoming romantic comedy “Last Christmas,” shared snaps on Saturday morning of her London-based birthday party on Friday night, after which she said she got only “two hours of sleep.”

She captioned the photo with Momoa and Harington: “Reunions never looked this hairy. #anyexcuseforamomoasandwich @prideofgypsies #birthdaybonazaparttwo.”

Part one of her birthday celebrations took place in Paris, with the star sharing a number of posts earlier this week.

Momoa, who played Clarke’s on-screen husband Khal Drogo in “Thrones,” commented on a video of her dancing to 50 Cent, saying: “Love u so fucking much. See u soon baby happy birthday xxx.”

The London visit wasn’t just for the party, though – the costars also reunited for a taping of “The Graham Norton Show” on Thursday, with Momoa heading straight for Clarke as he entered the stage, saying: “Hi baby.”

Jason ignored everyone and went straight to emilia lol pic.twitter.com/aqfU77RmqJ — dragon's daughter (@yeahclarke) October 25, 2019

Norton joked: “Reunited with your wife, it’s like it was meant to be.”

Later in the show – which also saw Momoa speak Dothraki – the “Aquaman” star told Norton he calls Clarke every time he’s in the UK.

The pair also told the talk show host they were planning to attend Clarke’s birthday party on Friday night.

After the taping, Momoa shared photos of the appearance on Instagram saying: “I love u my Khalessi. Happy birthday love.”

He wasn’t the only one who was excited to see Clarke.

Camilla Cabello, who performed on the show, had the best reaction to meeting the stars, squealing “My Queen!” to Clarke before hugging all of the guests and saying: “I’m sorry, I would just like to say, I am the biggest ‘Game of Thrones’ fan in the entire world. There’s a reason why I am the only red wine on this table, and it’s because I’m just freaking out to meet you guys.”

Cabello then went on to say she finished all eight seasons of the show in a month.

“I’ve never fangirled so hard in my life,” she said.

description: Business Insider - Clarke and Momoa also appeared on "The Graham Norton Show" this week, and the "Aquaman" star told Norton he calls Clarke every time he's in the UK.. Read more at businessinsider.sg
